reviews.title: Ramon's is Wonderful
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from our honeymoon in Belize. Our stay at Ramon's could not have been better. It had by far the best beach in San Pedro. Many hotels don't have easy access to the water. They handled all of excursions needs right at the hotel (snorkel, kayak, golf cart, etc) Our room was great. Very clean, good air conditioning. The only knock on Ramon's is the food. I don't recommend eating in the restaurant. There are plenty of good eats within a short walk.

My new wife and I arrived at Ramon’s 2 days after our Dec 4th wedding. We stayed for 7 nights at the resort; 1 night in a garden room and the other 6 in one of the two honeymoon suites. The suite we were in sat right on the beach itself… out our door, down 3 steps, and you are there… the water was about 40 ft away.
reviews.title: a honeymoon at Ramon's
Ramons came through
reviews.text: I really liked the abundance of trees all around Ramon’s… it really made you feel isolated, even though you are right by downtown and the airport. Ramon’s easily has the best beach of the many hotels right near San Pedro… although it is very small compared to most beaches I've been to, they have excellent chairs (with pads) to move around and lounge in. The down side of this perk is that a good many non Ramon’s guests find there way down to beach to mooch…

reviews.title: Batty for Ramons
reviews.text: There was more traffic right along the beach then I anticipated – both other tourists, locals on bike and foot… headed to town or stopping to try and sell you something. It was these times that I wished I had found something further away from downtown. One night we took a taxi down the island to the Victoria House… It was classier than Ramon’s and MUCH more isolated. But what was great about being so close to San Pedro is that you are within walking distance of downtown and the abundance of restaurants that are there… My wife and I walked down the beach and ate 90% of our meals right beside the ocean.

reviews.title: Ramon's Hotel in Belize
reviews.text: Hmmm… let’s see… things you might want to know. No one had really good fresh fruit like we expected being in the Caribbean – guess it is too hard to cart over from the mainland. My wife and I didn’t dive at all but we did snorkel twice… Mexico Rocks and Hol Chan. MR…C+ HC… A (must see). The pier at Ramon’s is the coolest… a TON of fish right off it… I was enthralled just snorkeling around it. Great place to go out and watch the sunset. Service at Ramon’s was an A… Jimmy was our personal favorite waiter. One night we took a book taxi up the island a ways and ate at a really cool restaurant and hotel called Capricorn… the front desk at Ramon’s arranged to whole thing. Everything is pretty pricey – from activities to food and even souvenirs… we were surprised that no one really came down on price, even people on the streets.

We just finished our honeymoon at Ramon's Village and have to say it has probably the best combination of ammenities and location in all of San Pedro. Yes, some hotels may be a little nicer for us Americans (Victoria House and Capricorn to mention a few) but those hotels are far from San Pedro (either water taxi, regular taxi or golf cart rental ($70 US per day)) and it is an effort to get into town.
reviews.title: Ramon's Village is Great.....Except for the Food!
Loved Ramones
reviews.text: Our package included breakfast which was really good (excellent breakfast burritos and loved the fresh papaya). Other than that, don't waste your time eating here. The food is very average and the prices are very expensive. I recommend you vist some of the places in town (details below).

reviews.title: Take me back!!!
reviews.text: Not the best prices in town ($4 US for a Belikin Beer and $9 for most blended drinks) but the quality was there. Our favorite by far was the Purple Parrot. It's basically a Pina Colada with Bailey's and boy is that combination dangerous. Also the bartender's are a really good group and every seems to have a great time.

reviews.title: A little bit of paradise!
reviews.text: Some people would call Buckingham Palace a drafty old barn. Some people can't be satisfied with accommodations unlike the best in the USA. Those people need to stay in the USA and then they won't be disappointed! Having traveled throughout the Caribbean and some in Mexico, I found Ramon's to be exactly what it should be...a taste of tropical life. The rooms were fine. They weren't fancy but they were in keeping with the motif of the resort: Mayan ruins and beachfront paradise. If one uses a little common sense and puts one of the room rugs outside the door, he can keep the sand at bay. It won't be there too long, however, since the maids clean the room daily, including changing the sheets! If you have a sand problem, I'm sure they will come sweep for you.

reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation
reviews.text: The food was good at Ramon's. The breakfasts were HUGE and the dinners were fine. We ate in town at Caramba, Mickey's and at Elvi's and all were great. I didn't find the food that expensive. We paid about $10-12 for lunches in town and got fresh ceviche, fish and other goodies. Dinner ran a little more, perhaps $20 per person if you were conservative.

reviews.title: Margaritaville
reviews.text: Ramon's is SOOOO laidback that we took our own booze and mixed our drinks in the room. No one seemed to care and on our last night, we bought chicken from a little restaurant down the street and ate it on the patio of the restaurant at Ramon's! They didn't seem to mind and even brought us ice for our room drinks!! I guarantee that you will NOT find a wait staff as good as that at Ramon's anywhere in the world.

Ramon's is a really lovely property. Our cabana was beautiful and the landscaping is gorgeous. The bar and the dive shop have great service; at other locations on the property the level of service is not as high. Our big problem - the pool isn't heated. So if you're going in the cooler months, please know that the pool may be colder than the ocean.
reviews.title: Nice, but could have better amenities

reviews.text: We stayed at Ramon's during our stay. The location of the resort is very pretty and very well maintained but having stayed at many hotels/resorts around the world, we thought it was a bit on the pricey side for what you get i.e dining and basic room. The highlight was of course the diving and the hotel has a great dive shop. Even though it is little bit more expensive than what you would find along the beach, it is worth it as the dive masters are very experience, friendly, and the facilities are good.
reviews.title: Diving is fantastic. Ramon is nice but not worth the $$$

reviews.text: We just returned from staying at Ramon's and had a wonderful vacation. You should not go expecting a "resort" in the sense that the word is used in Playa del Carmen, but you should expect a beautifully landscaped hotel with a georgous beachfront location. The rooms are fine, not beautiful, just clean and functional, but you spend so little time in them that it doesn't matter. If you get a garden room, ask for a second floor room since the balcony is nicer. We found the dive shop a little expensive, the same for the bar (especially if you're just coming out from spending time on the mainland as we were). We live in New York and the prices for drinks were on par with what we pay here ($10 american for a mararita etc. Belkin is still inexpensive). The resort had a good mix of familes, 20s and 30s sets. I looked around a lot before we booked Ramon's and were prefectly happy with our choice.
reviews.title: Ramon's is relaxing and beautiful
nice resort, rooms not so nice
reviews.text: First of all, if you don't dive, then there's not much reason to go to this island. There are far prettier beaches elsewhere in the Carribean. But if you do dive, this is a great place to go, as the reef is only a four minute boat ride away and you'll see fish you've never seen before.

The resort is immaculately kept, but the rooms are a bit worn. The bathroom is ridiculous. Showerhead is at about 5 feet, so unless you're a midget, you will never get to wash your hair in a satisfactory manner. Walls were thin and we could hear the people next to us and smell their cigarette smoke. If the resort updated these rooms, it would be a great place to stay. We found the food good, the service good, the diving crew good, all around pleasant stay except for being in the room. The beach chairs are hard on your back, so I reccomend bringing an inflatable raft to set on the chair to give you more cushion. Lots of sea grass off the beach, but there's about three feet of water you can wade into that's clear.
